intro: Cephalosorus brevipapposus, commonly known as the short-pappus corymbiferous, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a sprawling, shrub-like habit. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in corymbs, and it produces small, hairy seeds. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in dune environments.
